contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Airport | name = Ras Al Khaimah International Airport<BR><small>''(Ra'sal-Khaymah)''</small> | nativename = | nativename-a = مطار رأس الخيمة الدولي | nativename-r = | image = Ras Al Khaimah International Airport.jpg | image-width = | caption = | IATA = RKT | ICAO = OMRK <center>{{Location map|UAE|width=200|float=center |caption=|mark=Airplane_silhouette.svg|marksize=10 |label=RKT|position=bottom |lat_deg=25|lat_min=36|lat_sec=49|lat_dir=N |lon_deg=55|lon_min=56|lon_sec=20|lon_dir=E }}<small>Location of airport in UAE</small></center> | type = Public | owner = | operator = Department of Civil Aviation | city-served = | location = Ras al-Khaimah | elevation-f = 102 | elevation-m = 31 | coordinates = {{Coord|25|36|49|N|55|56|20|E|type:airport}} | website = www.rakairport.com | metric-elev = | metric-rwy = | r1-number = 16/34 | r1-length-f = 12,336 | r1-length-m = 3,760 | r1-surface = [[Asphalt]] | stat-year = | stat1-header = | stat1-data = | stat2-header = | stat2-data = | footnotes = }} '''Ras Al Khaimah International Airport''' {{airport codes|RKT|OMRK}} (alternatively Ra'sal-Khaymah, {{lang-ar|مطار رأس الخيمة الدولي}}) is an airport located {{convert|18|km|mi}} away from the city of [[Ras al-Khaimah]], [[United Arab Emirates]]. The airport was inaugurated by His Highness Sheikh [[Saqr bin Mohammad Al Qassimi]] in 1976. The airport has two passenger terminal buildings, a cargo terminal facility, aircraft maintenance facilities and an aviation training facility.<ref>http://www.rakairport.com/aboutus.html</ref> It reported a 58.5 per cent growth in the first quarter of 2012 compared with the same period of the previos year. <ref>http://www.tradearabia.com/news/TTN_217376.html RAK airport posts 58pc passenger growth</ref> Six scheduled carriers and over 25 charter airlines fly to the airport. The airport was the second in the GCC to secure the ISO 9001: 2000 accreditation for quality management.<ref>http://www.tradearabia.com/news/TTN_237966.html RAK airport woos European carriers</ref> ==Airlines and destinations== {{Airport-dest-list |[[Jetairfly]] | [[Brussels International Airport|Brussels]] (begins 26 October 2013) |[[RAK Airways]] | [[Cairo International Airport|Cairo]], [[Calicut International Airport|Calicut]], [[Shah Amanat International Airport|Chittagong]], [[Cochin International Airport|Cochin]] [[Shahjalal International Airport|Dhaka]], [[Doha International Airport|Doha]], [[King Abdulaziz International Airport|Jeddah]], [[Tribhuvan International Airport|Kathmandu]], [[Allama Iqbal International Airport|Lahore]], [[Bacha Khan International Airport|Peshawar]], [[Trivandrum International Airport|Trivandrum]] |[[Transaero Airlines]] | [[Domodedovo International Airport|Moscow-Domodedovo]] }} ==References== {{Reflist}} * {{cite web|title=RKT Ra'sal-Khaymah Airport|url=http://www.flightstats.com/go/Airport/airportDetails.do?airport=rkt&x=0&y=0|publisher=FlightStats|accessdate=2012-08-20}} ==External links== * [http://www.rakairport.com/ Ras Al Khaimah International Airport Homepage] * {{WAD|OMRK}} {{Airports in the United Arab Emirates}} [[Category:Airports in the United Arab Emirates]] [[Category:Ras al-Khaimah]] {{UnitedArabEmirates-struct-stub}} {{Asia-airport-stub}} {{UnitedArabEmirates-transport-stub}}
